result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donovan L Stone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Donovan L Stone was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donovan L Stone in court with attorney Gregory n Dutch. Prosecuting Atty Galen G Strebe appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DE does not believe he is competent.  STATE's position is that he is competent.  Calls Dr. Mark Phelps, duly sworn. Direct by the State.  Ex 1 marked.  Cross examination by Atty Dutch. Redirect by STATE.  Recross.   Atty Dutch calls Defn, duly sworn and testified.  Cross by State. CT: based on testimony of DR and DE, court finds DE competent to proceed. Burden of proof met by the State.  DE to return to DCJ pending further hearings. Will set for preliminary hearing.  Signs order for involuntary treatment. Court will appoint Atty Dutch through CDP.
Competency hearing on March 28, 2017 at 10:30 am.

of Competency Hearing 8/22/16.

Defendant Donovan L Stone in court with attorney Gregory n Dutch. Prosecuting Atty Galen G Strebe appeared for State of Wisconsin.  STATE: believes Defn is competent based on the reports.  ATTY Dutch: still has concerns regarding competency.  DEFN Duly sworn.  Direct by Atty Dutch.  Cross by the State.  State calls Dr. Vickery, duly sworn.  Direct by the State.  State moves to enter Dr. Vickery's report into evidence.  No objections.  Dr. Vickery's report accepted into evidence.  Cross by Atty Dutch.  No re-direct from State.  Dr. Vickery excused.  State questions whether or not DEFN has stated his position on competency.  Atty Dutch: DEFN stands mute.  DEFN believes he is competent.  State calls Dr. Chapin, duly sworn.  Direct by State.  Cross by State.  State offers Dr. Chapin's curriculum vitae as exhibit 1.  No objections.  Exhibit 1 marked and identified.  Questions of Dr. Chapin by Court.  Cross by Atty Dutch.  State requests additional questions of DEFN.  No objections from Atty Dutch.  Additional questions of DEFN by State.  Court questions DEFN.  State resumes questions of DEFN.  Court requests arguments.  Argument by State.  Argument by Atty Dutch.  Court engages counsel in colloquy.  Rebuttal by State.  Court finds DEFN is not competent.  Not likely DEFN will be restored to competency past statutory time period.  DEFN can not follow the trial or assist in his own defense.  Court invites briefs on legal arguments that DEFN can proceed as competent by giving up his rights.  State asks for a setover to prepare necessary paperwork for a committment under CH 51 under a civil commitment.  State requests 48 hours.  Effective 8/26/16, proceedings will be suspended and CH 51 will be addressed.  Court withholds signature on order until 8/26/16.
